Html:
I often experience long delays (5 sec to 5? Mins to > 1 hr) between the time a key is struck and when the function that handles the KeyDown or PreviewKeyDown callbacks are actually called. It seems to happen only when I have large number (4,400 ish) points loaded for a route and the zoom level is greater than 18ish.

Does anyone know what the issue is or have any suggestions other than “don’t do that”?

I am working in VBE2008 in with a Window Forms application

FoggArea

Here is one of my GPX files that seems to produce the problem (Big GPX File). I fed this file to “Demo.WindowsForms.exe (ver 1.7.0.0 created on 1/7/2014 7:13PM)” with the following results
1) As I click on the plus and/or minus zoom buttons, I noticed that it took longer for the slider bar to respond, the more zoomed in it was.
2) When the program reached the maximum zoom (by pulling the slider bar), the program crashed with the screen and details noted below.
3) If I used the slider bar to zoom all the way out, then clicked on the plus button, I was able to press the enter key about 19 times before I noticed any delays; on the 22nd pressing of the enter key or so, the slider bar disappeared and it took more than 10 mins for the program to respond (I killed it after 10 min or so).


I subsequently fed several smaller GPX files to the demo program. They didn’t seem to produce as much slowing but each caused the program to crash at max zoom. Many of these GPX files where produced by ExpertGPS itself (a program created by the person that defined the GPX file format) so I am pretty sure the file format is not the cause of the crashing. One of the small test GPX files (Small GPX File). I fed to the demo program allowed the program to zoom all the way in without crashing on a single occasion. Running the program with same file, before and after the time it did not crash did however cause a crash.


There are some differences between the behavior of the demo program and my program.
1) My program never crashes due to zooming (but I can only zoom with the keyboard and it becomes unresponsive at about zoom level 20)
2) I handle the file I/O with the GPX file using XmlDocumentinstead of the interface provided in GMaps.
3) Zooming is handled using keyboard commands and not the mouse
4) My program is being developed in VSE Basic 2008.

GreatMap is a wonderful tool. I have been able to produce a good looking, fast and effective tool (with only one flaw).

Help me Obewan Kanobie. You’re my only hope!


Thanks Wayne


Crash Info:
